name: inconspicuously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not easily or quickly noticed or seen, or does not attract attention: She lives inconspicuously in a rural town. The School of Diplomacy is housed inconspicuously in a nondescript building. See
inconspicuous
More examplesFewer examplesThey devised a plan for registering voters inconspicuously.He was always the first to offer help if someone needed it, though he preferred to do so inconspicuously.He lingered inconspicuously in the hotel lobby.Her books sit inconspicuously on the shelf among the files.
